html:
Studio Specialism 01: Experimental Formats 

In this module, we will delve into the realm of visually organising complex information and messages. Students will critically engage with elements such as structure, narrative, style, and mood, harnessing these elements to enhance the resonance and engagement of their work. Students will choose one of four specialist streams for their final outputs for the module: graphic design, illustration, photography, or animation. The choices they make will determine their approach for personal work during the module and their specialist route for the remainder of the programme.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Use media experimentation to address communication design problems, based on an research analysis, audience criteria, or project objectives.   

+  Consider the influence of historical and cultural contexts on specialist production methods.   

+  Generate visual ideas and outcomes in response to established themes or problems, utilising experimental approaches and production skills.   

+  Practice and present specialist visual communication and sequential design techniques in the creation of fictional or non-fictional outcomes.  


Lesson Plan - STUDIO SPECIALISM 01: Experimental Formats

Content is likely to change. Keep abreast of information on Canvas/Notion and notifications in the class sessions.

Week

Session topic description

Learning Focus

 

Week 1

 

Introduction to the module. Introduction to Visual Communication

Understanding requirements for this Module. Understanding the basics of visual communication and its importance in conveying complex messages.

Week 2

 

Experiment with Typography

Exploring the role of typography in communication and design.

Week 3

Experiment with Colour

Mastering color and learn how to apply them to evoke emotions and create meaning.

Week 4

 

Production Meeting

Review and Feedback

Week 5

 

Experiment with Experiment with Grids, Layout, and Composition

Structuring visual information using grids and layout principles. Exploring editorial design and the craft of zines and artist books

Week 6

 

Experiment with Sequence and Narratives

Creating structured narratives through sequential design.

Week 7

 

Experiment with spatial art and 3 D

Importance of Space in Art. How space interacts with art to evoke emotional or intellectual responses.

Week 8

 

Experiment with Diorama & Stop Motion

Exploring 3D paper construction like diorama as visual storytelling.  Explore basics in Stop Motion.

Week 9

 

Production Meeting

Review and Feedback

Week 10

 

Prototyping & Production

Refining prototypes and preparing for final production.

Week 11

 

Prototyping & Production
Presentation Preparation

Refining prototypes and preparing for final production.  Prepare your final outcomes to be displayed

Week 12

 

Portfolio Submission & Presentation

Submit on Canvas. Present your final outcomes in a room
